com.taursys.xml
Class CheckboxField

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.xml.Component
        |
        +--com.taursys.xml.Parameter
              |
              +--com.taursys.xml.AbstractField
                    |
                    +--com.taursys.xml.CheckboxField
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentComponent, MapperComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTMLCheckBox
public class CheckboxField
extends AbstractField

CheckboxField is a component which inputs and renders a selected state. It responds to input events and stores the state in the model. By default, this component uses a DefaultCheckboxModel to store the state. You can change this by directly setting the model property or overriding the createDefaultModel method.

This component can render its value to an xml Document (thru the DocumentAdapter). The id property indicates which element to render in the Document. The attributeName property is only used with an AttributeSelectFieldRenderer to indicate which attribute to store the value in. By default, this component creates and uses a CheckboxFieldRenderer. Override the createDefaultRenderer or use the setRenderer to use a different renderer.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Marty Phelan

Constructor Detail

CheckboxField

public CheckboxField()
Constructs a new CheckboxField with a default model and renderer. The default model, a DefaultCheckboxModel, is created via the createDefaultModel method in the Parameter superclass. The default renderer, a CheckboxFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method.

CheckboxField

public CheckboxField(int javaDataType)
Constructs a new CheckboxField for the given datatype with a default model and renderer. The default model, a DefaultCheckboxModel, is created via the createDefaultModel method in the Parameter superclass. The default renderer, a CheckboxFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method.

javaDataType - data type for new model
